page.title: 19AN AMBULANCE DEPOT
page.content: The Ambulance service is part of The National Health Service.To become a fully qualified ambulanceman you must successfully complete an 8 week course, consisting 2 week driving,6 weeks theory and practical at a regional traning school and then do 12 months service at an ambulance station on all types of ambulance work.The ambulances are manned 24 hours a day 7 days a week. There are two personnel to each ambulance,driver and attendant who cover all aspects or the jobs,from the general work,outpatients etc to the accident and emergencies which includes Doctors call,Road Traffic accidents, Industrial and domestic accidents, collapses, maternities etc. The ambulances are radio controlled. We carry resuscitation equipment & other aid equipment.
